name: Novotel Barossa Valley Resort

reviews.title: It's just a Novotel.....
reviews.text: Hotel - Rooms ok nothing special. Dining area quite nice. Pool area a bit skummy. We had to leave our poolside chairs because of the swarms of flies that made teh place feel a bit third world. Nice big pool though which keeps teh flies at bay for as long as you can stand your fingers and toes shriveling.

reviews.title: Brilliant
reviews.text: Service - Poor. Prior to our visit I asked hotel reception to get us a room next to the restaurant so our baby monitor would work, which was confirmed before we booked. Ended up about 100M away. "Everybody else checked in before you"

reviews.title: give this a miss
reviews.text: We were looking forward to an adult meal and pre dinner drink. No tonic at the bar - "We've run out" and no coffee "It's broken" - how does a hotel run out of tonic water & coffee?? and managed to get a restaurant table by the window so we could, with the aid of an ash tray, the blinds and occaisional acrobatics just get a signal on the monitor. The waitresses were friendly but continually forgot we were there. No coffee/dessert/nightcap as we were simply forgotten about - I think our waitress had clocked off just after the main course was delivered. Food average...they did something wierd with a Kangaroo steak - a month later I still can't decide if I liked it or hated it.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: After battling the checkout scrum the following morning, the bill was way more than the place was worth, even with decent service. Wouldn't go back again although by the bus loads of tour coaches that were at the doors to deliver punters when we checked in, they probably don't care much.

reviews.title: Can't wait to come back
reviews.text: At the end of the day, it's just a Novotel. Mid class business hotel in a picturesque valley.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Novotel Barossa Valley as part of a tour around Australia and were very pleased with it. Service from Reception was fine, our room was clean and comfortable, with beautiful views from the balcony.

reviews.title: loved the hotel was disgusted with service and managment
reviews.text: Pleased to find that the room was equipped with a toaster, fridge, microwave, 2 ring hob and some basic utensils. It meant we could sort our own breakfast rather than go in the restaurant.

reviews.title: Very happy with the Novotel
reviews.text: Ate breakfast in the buffet one morning and it was really nice. Didn't try the restaurant because we preferred to investigate what the town had to offer instead.

reviews.title: a chain is a chain is a chain
reviews.text: If you stay here, I'd recommend hiring a car. It's about 7km into the town so if you don't have a car, you'd run up a lot of taxi fares.

reviews.title: More motel style than resort
reviews.text: We stayed here for a Friday night with a group of about 12 of us. They where able to accomodate us at very late notice, after we got rained out elsewhere, which was much appreciated.

reviews.title: Good but a little dated
reviews.text: This isnt your traditional novotel style hotel. The rooms are all situated as individual dwellings much like motel rooms where you can pull your car up close in the carpark.

reviews.title: Good but nothing to write home about
reviews.text: The furniture and fittings are reasonable, we stayed in a two bedroom apartment. The carpet was extremley stained in the unit we had. Each unit has a self contained kitchenette.

reviews.title: Overpriced
reviews.text: The views from the rooms are beautiful. The main dining area is quite lovely with stunning views.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: Breakfast worked out to $15 per head which was more than reasonable. Nothing outstanding but your normal hotel full cooked breakfast buffet.

aka: Novotel Barossa Valley Hotel Rowland Flat
description: Nestled in the picturesque Barossa Valley wine region, Novotel Barossa Valley Resort is just a 55 minute drive from Adelaide. Surrounded by world-famous wineries, the resort offers a multitude of features: enjoy a game of golf at Tanunda Pines Golf Course or a treatment at Endota Spa. The resort features 140 rooms with private balconies and kitchenette facilities. It also boasts an award-winning restaurant, tasting room, heated outdoor pool, tennis courts, gymnasium, an 18-hole golf course and refurbished conference facilities for up to 250 delegates. Novotel Barossa Valley Resort is a non-smoking resort.
